name: Susquehanna Collieries Company v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, Appellant
name_abbreviation: Susquehanna Collieries Co. v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review

judges: Before Schaffer, C. J., Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Barnes and Patterson, JJ.
parties: Susquehanna Collieries Company v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The order of the Superior Court is affirmed on Judge Parker’s opinion. Costs to be paid by appellant.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Charles B. Davis, Special Deputy Attorney General, for appellant.
casebody.head_matter:
Susquehanna Collieries Company v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, Appellant.
Argued January 22, 1940.
Before Schaffer, C. J., Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Barnes and Patterson, JJ.
Charles B. Davis, Special Deputy Attorney General, for appellant.
Henry A. Cordon, for appellee.
March 25, 1940:
